instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1706: What is A1706? A1706 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3071, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00239, 820-00923..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Won't bootup, high fan for 5secs, shuts off, then steady high spin
threads.message:
Hello, have a <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> or 00239), doesn't bootup (no usbC connector pong sound or image on display), but right fan starts out spin high for like 5 or so second, shutoff then comes back on high again and remains on. Left fan only comes on when i leave the trackpad unplugged, so suspect there may also be issues with the trackpad.

No liquid damage, but the laptop was dropped, which is when the issue started. Not sure where to start here as the usual power rails are all present. 

The <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1706</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> laptops should bootup even when the keyboard is discounted, right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Won't bootup, high fan for 5secs, shuts off, then steady high spin
threads.message:
All iCore must start automatically, when charger is connected.
Dropped machine is usually a nightmare to repair.
You could have some broken traces, or balls, under some BGA chip.
Disconnect all from the MLB, let only USB-C connected and test USB activity when charger is connected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Won't bootup, high fan for 5secs, shuts off, then steady high spin
threads.message: The is power coming from the usbc port just no activity. I can power up a usb device, but when I plug in a thumb drive or external drive, I don?t get any activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Won't bootup, high fan for 5secs, shuts off, then steady high spin
threads.message: If machine is confirmed as dropped, I wouldn't waste time on it...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: Won't bootup, high fan for 5secs, shuts off, then steady high spin
threads.message: Yep, it was dropped. Was hoping there some key signals that one could check for after the fan turns on. But you are probably right as there most like is a broken trace, either one of the components or between the layers of the board, Thanks for the assist.
